arabicText: قَدْ أَفْلَحَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنُونَ
englishTranslationText: Successful	indeed	are	the	believers.
romanUrduTranslationText: Beshak	murād	ko	pahuñche	Imān	wāle.

arabicText: ٱلَّذِينَ هُمْ فِى صَلَاتِهِمْ خَـٰشِعُونَ
englishTranslationText: Those	who	humbly	cry	in	their	prayers.
romanUrduTranslationText: Jo	apni	Namāz	meiñ	gid-gidāte	haiñ

arabicText: وَٱلَّذِينَ هُمْ عَنِ ٱللَّغْوِ مُعْرِضُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	who	do	not	incline	towards	indecent	
matters.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	woh	jo	kisi	be-hoodah	bāt	ki	ṭaraf		il
tefāt	nahiñ	karte

arabicText: وَٱلَّذِينَ هُمْ لِلزَّكَوٰةِ فَـٰعِلُونَ
englishTranslationText: And	who	pay	the	(obligatory)	charity.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	woh	ke	Zakāt	dene	ka	kām	karte	haiñ

arabicText: وَٱلَّذِينَ هُمْ لِفُرُوجِهِمْ حَـٰفِظُونَ
englishTranslationText: And	who	guard	their	private	organs.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	woh	jo	Apni	sharamgāhoñ	ki	hifāzat	
karte	haiñ

arabicText: إِلَّا عَلَىٰٓ أَزْوَٰجِهِمْ أَوْ مَا مَلَكَتْ أَيْمَـٰنُهُمْ فَإِنَّهُمْ غَيْرُ مَلُومِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Except	from	their	wives	or	the	legal	
bondwomen	that	they	possess,	for	then	
there	is	no	blame	upon	them.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Magar	apni	bibiyoñ	yā	Shar’ayi	bāñdiyoñ	
par	jo	unke	hāth	ki	milk	haiñ	ki	in	par	koi	
malāmat	nahiñ

arabicText: فَمَنِ ٱبْتَغَىٰ وَرَآءَ ذَٰلِكَ فَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْعَادُونَ
englishTranslationText:
So	whoever	desires	more	than	these	two	-	
they	are	crossing	the	limits.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	jo	in	do	ke	siwā	kuchh	aur	chāheiñ	wohi	
had	se	badhne	wāle	haiñ

arabicText: وَٱلَّذِينَ هُمْ لِأَمَـٰنَـٰتِهِمْ وَعَهْدِهِمْ رَٰعُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	those	who	keep	proper	regard	for	
their	trusts	and	their	pledges.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	woh	jo	apni	amānatoñ	aur	apne	‘ahad	
ki	ri’āyat	karte	haiñ

arabicText: وَٱلَّذِينَ هُمْ عَلَىٰ صَلَوَٰتِهِمْ يُحَافِظُونَ
englishTranslationText: And	who	guard	their	prayers
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	woh	jo	apni	Namāzoñ	ki	nigehbāni	
karte	haiñ

arabicText: أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْوَٰرِثُونَ
englishTranslationText: They	are	the	inheritors.
romanUrduTranslationText: Yahi	log	wāris	haiñ.

arabicText: ٱلَّذِينَ يَرِثُونَ ٱلْفِرْدَوْسَ هُمْ فِيهَا خَـٰلِدُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Those	who	will	get	the	inheritance	of	
Paradise;	they	will	abide	in	it	forever.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ki	Firdous	ki	meerās	pāyeiñ	ge	woh	us	
meiñ	hamesha	raheiñ-ge

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا ٱلْإِنسَـٰنَ مِن سُلَـٰلَةٍۢ مِّن طِينٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	We	created	man	from	a	chosen	
soil.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	hamne	ādmi	ko	chuni	hui	mit
ti	se	banāyā

arabicText: ثُمَّ جَعَلْنَـٰهُ نُطْفَةًۭ فِى قَرَارٍۢ مَّكِينٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
Then	made	him	a	drop	of	fluid	in	a	secure	
shelter.
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	usey	pāni	ki	boond	kiya	ek	mazboot	thehrāo	meiñ

arabicText: ثُمَّ خَلَقْنَا ٱلنُّطْفَةَ عَلَقَةًۭ فَخَلَقْنَا ٱلْعَلَقَةَ مُضْغَةًۭ فَخَلَقْنَا ٱلْمُضْغَةَ عِظَـٰمًۭا فَكَسَوْنَا ٱلْعِظَـٰمَ لَحْمًۭا ثُمَّ أَنشَأْنَـٰهُ خَلْقًا ءَاخَرَ ۚ فَتَبَارَكَ ٱللَّهُ أَحْسَنُ ٱلْخَـٰلِقِينَ
englishTranslationText:
We	then	turned	the	drop	of	fluid	into	a	clot	of	blood,	then	the	clot	into	a	small	lump	of	flesh,	
then	the	lump	into	bones,	then	covered	the	bones	with	flesh;	then	developed	it	in	a	different	
mould;	therefore	Most	Auspicious	is	Allah,	the	Best	Creator.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	Hamne	us	pāni	ki	boond	ko	khoon	ki	phatak	kiya,	phir	khoon	ki	phatak	ko	gosht	ki	boti,	phir	
gosht	ki	boti	ko	had-diyāñ	phir	un	had-diyoñ	par	gosht	pahnāyā,	phir	usey	aur	soorat	meiñ	uthān	
di,	to	badi	barkat	wāla	hai	Allah	sabse	behtar	banāne	wāla

arabicText: ثُمَّ إِنَّكُم بَعْدَ ذَٰلِكَ لَمَيِّتُونَ
englishTranslationText: Then	after	that,	certainly	all	of	you	are	to	die.
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	Uske	b’ād	tum	zaroor	marne	wāle	ho.

arabicText: ثُمَّ إِنَّكُمْ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ تُبْعَثُونَ
englishTranslationText: Then	you	will	all	be	raised	on	the	Day	of	Resurrection.
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	tum	sab	Qayāmat	ke	din	uthāye	jāo	ge

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا فَوْقَكُمْ سَبْعَ طَرَآئِقَ وَمَا كُنَّا عَنِ ٱلْخَلْقِ غَـٰفِلِينَ
englishTranslationText: And	indeed	We	have	created	seven	paths	above	you;	and	We	are	not	unmindful	of	the	creation.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	be-shak	Hamne	tumhāre	upar	sāt	rāheiñ	banāyiñ	aur	Ham	khalq	se	be-khabar	nahiñ.

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا فَوْقَكُمْ سَبْعَ طَرَآئِقَ وَمَا كُنَّا عَنِ ٱلْخَلْقِ غَـٰفِلِينَ
englishTranslationText: And	indeed	We	have	created	seven	paths	above	you;	and	We	are	not	unmindful	of	the	creation.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	be-shak	Hamne	tumhāre	upar	sāt	rāheiñ	banāyiñ	aur	Ham	khalq	se	be-khabar	nahiñ.

arabicText: وَأَنزَلْنَا مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَآءًۢ بِقَدَرٍۢ فَأَسْكَنَّـٰهُ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ ۖ وَإِنَّا عَلَىٰ ذَهَابٍۭ بِهِۦ لَقَـٰدِرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	sent	down	water	from	the	sky	in	
proper	measure,	then	stored	it	in	the	
earth;	and	indeed	We	are	Able	to	take	it	
away!
romanUrduTranslationText:
.Aur	Hamne	āasmān	se	pāni	utārā	ek	
andāze	par	phir	usey	zameen	meiñ	
thahrāyā,	aur	be-shak	Ham	uske	le	jāne	par	
qādir	haiñ

arabicText: فَأَنشَأْنَا لَكُم بِهِۦ جَنَّـٰتٍۢ مِّن نَّخِيلٍۢ وَأَعْنَـٰبٍۢ لَّكُمْ فِيهَا فَوَٰكِهُ كَثِيرَةٌۭ وَمِنْهَا تَأْكُلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
So	with	it	We	produced	gardens	of	date
palms	and	grapes	for	you,	in	which	is	
abundant	fruit	for	you	and	you	eat	
therefrom.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	us	se	Hamne	tumhāre	liye	bāgh	paidā	
kiye	khajooroñ	aur	angooroñ	ke	tumhāre	
liye	un	meiñ	bahot	se	mewe	haiñ	aur	unhiñ	
se	khāte	ho

arabicText: وَشَجَرَةًۭ تَخْرُجُ مِن طُورِ سَيْنَآءَ تَنۢبُتُ بِٱلدُّهْنِ وَصِبْغٍۢ لِّلْـَٔاكِلِينَ ٢٠
englishTranslationText:
And	created	the	tree	that	comes	forth	
from	Mount	Sinai	-	that	grows	containing	
oil	and	curry	for	the	eaters.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	woh	peird	paidā	kiya	ke	Toor-e-Seenā	
se	nikaltā	hai	le	kar	ugtā	hai	tail	aur	khāne	
wāloñ	ke	liye	sālan

arabicText: وَإِنَّ لَكُمْ فِى ٱلْأَنْعَـٰمِ لَعِبْرَةًۭ ۖ نُّسْقِيكُم مِّمَّا فِى بُطُونِهَا وَلَكُمْ فِيهَا مَنَـٰفِعُ كَثِيرَةٌۭ وَمِنْهَا تَأْكُلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	in	the	cattle	is	a	lesson	for	
you;	We	give	you	to	drink	what	is	in	their	
bellies,	and	there	are	many	benefits	for	
you	in	them,	and	in	them	is	your	food.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	tumhāre	liye	chaupāyoñ	meiñ	
samjhne	ka	maqām	hai,	Ham	tumheiñ	
pilāte	haiñ	us	meiñ	se	jo	unke	pait	meiñ	hai	
aur	tumhāre	liye	un	meiñ	bahut	fāyde	haiñ	
aur	un	se	tumhāri	khurāk	hai

arabicText: وَعَلَيْهَا وَعَلَى ٱلْفُلْكِ تُحْمَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	you	are	carried	on	them	and	on	the	
ship.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	unpar	aur	kashti	par	suwār	kiye	jāte	
ho

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَا نُوحًا إِلَىٰ قَوْمِهِۦ فَقَالَ يَـٰقَوْمِ ٱعْبُدُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ مَا لَكُم مِّنْ إِلَـٰهٍ غَيْرُهُۥٓ ۖ أَفَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	We	sent	Nooh	towards	his	
people	-	he	therefore	said,	“O	my	people!	
Worship	Allah,	you	do	not	have	any	other	
God	except	Him;	so	do	you	not	fear?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	hamne	Nūh	ko	uski	Qaom	ki	
taraf	bhejā	to	usne	kahā:	Aye	meri	Qaom!	
Allah	ko	poojo	uske	siwā	tumhārā	koi	
Khudā	nahiñ	to	kya	tumheiñ	dar	nahiñ?

arabicText: فَقَالَ ٱلْمَلَؤُا۟ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ مِن قَوْمِهِۦ مَا هَـٰذَآ إِلَّا بَشَرٌۭ مِّثْلُكُمْ يُرِيدُ أَن يَتَفَضَّلَ عَلَيْكُمْ وَلَوْ شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ لَأَنزَلَ مَلَـٰٓئِكَةًۭ مَّا سَمِعْنَا بِهَـٰذَا فِىٓ ءَابَآئِنَا ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
englishTranslationText:
So	the	disbelieving	chieftains	of	his	people	
said,	“He	is	just	a	human	like	you,	he	
wishes	to	become	your	leader;	and	had	
Allah	willed,	He	would	have	sent	down	
angels;	We	did	not	hear	this	in	the	case	of	
our	forefathers.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	uski	Qaom	ke	jin	sardāroñ	ne	kufr	kiya	
bole:	yeh	to	nahiñ	magar	tum	jaisā	ādmi,	
chāhtā	hai	ke	tumhārā	badā	bane,	aur	Allah	chāhtā	to	Firishte	utārtā	hamne	to	yeh	agle	bāp	
dādāoñ	meiñ	na	sunā

arabicText: إِنْ هُوَ إِلَّا رَجُلٌۢ بِهِۦ جِنَّةٌۭ فَتَرَبَّصُوا۟ بِهِۦ حَتَّىٰ حِينٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
“He	is	not	but	a	man	insane,	therefore	
wait	for	some	time.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Woh	to	nahiñ	magar	ek	diwāna	mard	to	kuchh	zamāne	tak	uskā	intizār	kiye	raho

arabicText: قَالَ رَبِّ ٱنصُرْنِى بِمَا كَذَّبُونِ
englishTranslationText: Submitted	Nooh,	“My	Lord!	Help	me	as	they	deny	me.”
romanUrduTranslationText: .Nūh	ne	arz	ki:	Aye	mere	Rab	meri	madad	farmā	is	par	ke	unhoñ	ne	mujhe	jhutlāyā.

arabicText: فَأَوْحَيْنَآ إِلَيْهِ أَنِ ٱصْنَعِ ٱلْفُلْكَ بِأَعْيُنِنَا وَوَحْيِنَا فَإِذَا جَآءَ أَمْرُنَا وَفَارَ ٱلتَّنُّورُ ۙ فَٱسْلُكْ فِيهَا مِن كُلٍّۢ زَوْجَيْنِ ٱثْنَيْنِ وَأَهْلَكَ إِلَّا مَن سَبَقَ عَلَيْهِ ٱلْقَوْلُ مِنْهُمْ ۖ وَلَا تُخَـٰطِبْنِى فِى ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوٓا۟ ۖ إِنَّهُم مُّغْرَقُونَ
englishTranslationText:
So	We	sent	him	the	divine	revelation	that,	“Make	the	ship	in	front	of	Our	sight,	and	by	Our	
command	–	then	when	Our	command	comes	and	the	oven	overflows,	embark	in	it	two	of	every	
couple,	and	from	your	household	except	those	upon	whom	the	Word	has	been	decreed;	and	do	
not	speak	to	Me	in	respect	of	these	unjust	people;	they	will	surely	be	drowned.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
.To	Hamne	usey	Waḥi	bheji	ke	hamāri	nigāh	ke	sāmne	aur	Hamāre	ḥukmse	kashti	banā	phir	jab	
Hamārā	ḥukm	āaye	aur	tannoor	uble	to	us	meiñ	bithā	le	har	jode	meiñ	se	do	aur	apne	ghar	wāle	
magar	un	meiñ	se	woh	jinpar	bāt	pehle	padh	chuki	aur	un	zālimoñ	ke	mu’āmle	meiñ	mujhse	bāt	
na	karnā	yeh	zaroor	duboye	jayeñ	ge.

arabicText: فَإِذَا ٱسْتَوَيْتَ أَنتَ وَمَن مَّعَكَ عَلَى ٱلْفُلْكِ فَقُلِ ٱلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ ٱلَّذِى نَجَّىٰنَا مِنَ ٱلْقَوْمِ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
“And	when	you	and	those	with	you	have	
safely	boarded	the	ship	say,	‘All	praise	is	
to	Allah	Who	has	rescued	us	from	the	
unjust.’	”
romanUrduTranslationText:
.Phir	jab	theek	baithe	kashti	par	tu	aur	tere	
sāth	wāle	to	kah:	sab	khoobiyāñ	Allah	ko	
jisne	hameiñ	un	ƶālimoñ	se	najāt	di.

arabicText: وَقُل رَّبِّ أَنزِلْنِى مُنزَلًۭا مُّبَارَكًۭا وَأَنتَ خَيْرُ ٱلْمُنزِلِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	pray,	“My	Lord!	Cause	me	to	alight	at	
a	blessed	place	–	and	You	are	the	Best	of	
all	who	bring	to	settle.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	arz	kar	ke:	Aye	mere	Rab	Mujhe	barkat	
wāli	jagah	utār	aur	tu	sabse	behtar	utārne		
wāla	hai.

arabicText: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَـٰتٍۢ وَإِن كُنَّا لَمُبْتَلِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed,	surely	in	this	are	signs	and	indeed	
surely,	We	were	examining.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Beshak	is	meiñ	zaroor	nishāniyāñ	haiñ	aur	
be-shak		zaroor	ham	jāñchne	wāle	the

arabicText: ثُمَّ أَنشَأْنَا مِنۢ بَعْدِهِمْ قَرْنًا ءَاخَرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Then	after	them,	We	created	another	
generation.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	unke	b’ād	Hamne	aur	sangat	(Qaum)	
paidā	ki.

arabicText: فَأَرْسَلْنَا فِيهِمْ رَسُولًۭا مِّنْهُمْ أَنِ ٱعْبُدُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ مَا لَكُم مِّنْ إِلَـٰهٍ غَيْرُهُۥٓ ۖ أَفَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
romanUrduTranslationText:
.To	un	meiñ	ek	Rasool	unhiñ	meiñ	se	bhejā	
ke	Allah	ki	bandagi	karo	uske	siwā	
tumhārā	koi	khudā	nahiñ	to	kya	tumheiñ	
dar	nahiñ

arabicText: وَقَالَ ٱلْمَلَأُ مِن قَوْمِهِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ وَكَذَّبُوا۟ بِلِقَآءِ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ وَأَتْرَفْنَـٰهُمْ فِى ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا مَا هَـٰذَآ إِلَّا بَشَرٌۭ مِّثْلُكُمْ يَأْكُلُ مِمَّا تَأْكُلُونَ مِنْهُ وَيَشْرَبُ مِمَّا تَشْرَبُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	said	the	leaders	of	his	people,	who	
disbelieved	and	denied	the	confronting	of	
the	Hereafter	-	and	We	had	given	them	
comfort	in	the	worldly	life	–	that,	“He	is	
nothing	but	a	human	like	you,	he	eats	
from	what	you	eat	and	drinks	from	what	
you	drink.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	bole	us	Qaom	ke	sardār	jinhoñ	ne	kufr	
kiya	aur	āakhirat	ki	hāzri	jhutlāyā	aur	
Hamne	unheiñ	duniyā	ki	Zindagi	meiñ	
chain	diyā	ke	yeh	to	nahiñ	magar	tum	jaisā	
ādmi	Jo	tum	khāte	ho	usi	meiñ	se	khātā	hai	
aur	jo	tum	peete	ho	usi	meiñ	se	peetā	hai.

arabicText: وَلَئِنْ أَطَعْتُم بَشَرًۭا مِّثْلَكُمْ إِنَّكُمْ إِذًۭا لَّخَـٰسِرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
“If	you	were	to	obey	a	human	like	
yourselves,	then	surely	you	are	losers!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	agar	tum	Kisi	apne	jaise	ādmi	ki	it’āt	
karo	jab	to	tum	zaroor	ghāte	meiñ	ho	.

arabicText: أَيَعِدُكُمْ أَنَّكُمْ إِذَا مِتُّمْ وَكُنتُمْ تُرَابًۭا وَعِظَـٰمًا أَنَّكُم مُّخْرَجُونَ
englishTranslationText:
“Does	he	promise	you	that	when	you	die	
and	turn	into	dust	and	bones,	you	will	be	
raised	again?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kyā	tumheiñ	yeh	w’āda	detā	hai	ke	tum	jab	
marjāo	ge	aur	mit-ti	aur	had-diyāñ	ho	
jāoge	iske	b’ād	phir	nikāle	jāoge	.

arabicText: ۞ هَيْهَاتَ هَيْهَاتَ لِمَا تُوعَدُونَ
englishTranslationText:
“How	remote,	(really)	how	remote	is	the	
promise	you	are	given!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kitni	door	hai	kitni	door	hai	jo	tumheiñ	
wā’da	diyā	jātā	hai

arabicText: إِنْ هِىَ إِلَّا حَيَاتُنَا ٱلدُّنْيَا نَمُوتُ وَنَحْيَا وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمَبْعُوثِينَ
englishTranslationText: “There	is	nothing	except	our	life	of	this	world,	we	die	and	we	live,	and	we	are	not	to	be	raised.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh	to	nahiñ	magar	Hamāri	duniyā	ki	
zindagi	ke	ham	marte	jeete	haiñ	aur	
hameiñ	uthnā	nahiñ.
